intro: Draba alpina var. bellii, commonly known as the Alpine Bell Draba, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–15 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, often with a hairy surface. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in a raceme. It is native to alpine and subalpine regions of Europe and is adapted to cold, rocky environments.
